com.esri.mo2.map.draw
Class RandomColorSchemes

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.map.draw.RandomColorSchemes
All Implemented Interfaces:
ColorScheme
Direct Known Subclasses:
RandomColorSchemes.Brights, RandomColorSchemes.Darks, RandomColorSchemes.Pastels
public abstract class RandomColorSchemes
extends Object
implements ColorScheme

Provides several color schemes where getNext() provides colors that are generated randomly and on-the-fly. There is potentially no limit to the number of Colors that are generated in this way, and so these color schemes cannot be indexed. Consequently, it is not possible to deterministically repeat Colors produced by the scehemes in this class. If you want to be able to index or be sure of getting the same Colors, then you will need to use the indexed color scheme provided by the SampleColorSchemes class.

Random numbers are initialized using the current system time as seed. The range of color values used is described in the javadoc for each sub-class. Successive Color hues are chosen to be significantly different, so you can expect that two successive colors will be sufficiently different.

See Also:
SampleColorSchemes
